  16. open Printf

  18. ‌let mklib out files opts =
  19.   if Config.ccomp_type = "msvc"
  20.   then let machine =
  21.     if Config.architecture="amd64"
  22.     then "-machine:AMD64 "
  23.     else ""
  24.   in
  25.   Printf.sprintf "link -lib -nologo %s-out:%s %s %s" machine out opts files
  26.   else Printf.sprintf "%s rcs %s %s %s" Config.ar out opts files

  28. (* PR#4783: under Windows, don't use absolute paths because we do
  29.    not know where the binary distribution will be installed. *)
  30. ‌let compiler_path name =
  31.   if Sys.os_type = "Win32" then name else Filename.concat Config.bindir name

  33. ‌let bytecode_objs = ref []  (* .cmo,.cma,.ml,.mli files to pass to ocamlc *)
  34. and native_objs = ref []    (* .cmx,.ml,.mli files to pass to ocamlopt *)
  35. and c_objs = ref []         (* .o, .a, .obj, .lib, .dll, .dylib, .so files to
  36.                                pass to mkdll and ar *)
  37. and caml_libs = ref []      (* -cclib to pass to ocamlc, ocamlopt *)
  38. and caml_opts = ref []      (* -ccopt to pass to ocamlc, ocamlopt *)
  39. and dynlink = ref Config.supports_shared_libraries
  40. and failsafe = ref false    (* whether to fall back on static build only *)
  41. and c_libs = ref []         (* libs to pass to mkdll and ocamlc -cclib *)
  42. and c_Lopts = ref []      (* options to pass to mkdll and ocamlc -cclib *)
  43. and c_opts = ref []       (* options to pass to mkdll and ocamlc -ccopt *)
  44. and ld_opts = ref []        (* options to pass only to the linker *)
  45. and ocamlc = ref (compiler_path "ocamlc")
  46. and ocamlc_opts = ref []    (* options to pass only to ocamlc *)
  47. and ocamlopt = ref (compiler_path "ocamlopt")
  48. and ocamlopt_opts = ref []  (* options to pass only to ocamlc *)
  49. and output = ref "a"        (* Output name for OCaml part of library *)
  50. and output_c = ref ""       (* Output name for C part of library *)
  51. and rpath = ref []          (* rpath options *)
  52. and debug = ref false       (* -g option *)
  53. and verbose = ref false

  55. ‌let starts_with s pref =
  56.   String.length s >= String.length pref &&
  57.   String.sub s 0 (String.length pref) = pref
  58. ‌let ends_with = Filename.check_suffix
  59. ‌let chop_prefix s pref =
  60.   String.sub s (String.length pref) (String.length s - String.length pref)

  62. exception Bad_argument of string

  64. ‌let print_version () =
  65.   printf "ocamlmklib, version %s\n" Sys.ocaml_version;
  66.   exit 0

  68. ‌let print_version_num () =
  69.   printf "%s\n" Sys.ocaml_version;
  70.   exit 0

  72. ‌let parse_arguments argv =
  73.   let args = Stack.create () in
  74.   let push_args ~first arr =
  75.     for i = Array.length arr - 1 downto first do
  76.       Stack.push arr.(i) args
  77.     done
  78.   in
  79.   let next_arg s =
  80.     if Stack.is_empty args
  81.     then raise (Bad_argument("Option " ^ s ^ " expects one argument"));
  82.     Stack.pop args
  83.   in
  84.   push_args ~first:1 argv;
  85.   while not (Stack.is_empty args) do
  86. ‌    let s = Stack.pop args in
  87.     if s = "-args" then
  88.       push_args ~first:0 (Arg.read_arg (next_arg s))
  89.     else if s = "-args0" then
  90.       push_args ~first:0 (Arg.read_arg0 (next_arg s))
  91.     else if ends_with s ".cmo" || ends_with s ".cma" then
  92.       bytecode_objs := s :: !bytecode_objs
  93.     else if ends_with s ".cmx" then
  94.       native_objs := s :: !native_objs
  95.     else if ends_with s ".ml" || ends_with s ".mli" then
  96.      (bytecode_objs := s :: !bytecode_objs;
  97.       native_objs := s :: !native_objs)
  98.     else if List.exists (ends_with s)
  99.                         [".o"; ".a"; ".obj"; ".lib"; ".dll"; ".dylib"; ".so"]
  100.     then
  101.       c_objs := s :: !c_objs
  102.     else if s = "-cclib" then
  103.       caml_libs := next_arg s :: "-cclib" :: !caml_libs
  104.     else if s = "-ccopt" then
  105.       caml_opts := next_arg s :: "-ccopt" :: !caml_opts
  106.     else if s = "-custom" then
  107.       dynlink := false
  108.     else if s = "-I" then
  109.       caml_opts := next_arg s :: "-I" :: !caml_opts
  110.     else if s = "-failsafe" then
  111.       failsafe := true
  112.     else if s = "-g" then
  113.       debug := true
  114.     else if s = "-h" || s = "-help" || s = "--help" then
  115.       raise (Bad_argument "")
  116.     else if s = "-ldopt" then
  117.       ld_opts := next_arg s :: !ld_opts
  118.     else if s = "-linkall" then
  119.       caml_opts := s :: !caml_opts
  120.     else if starts_with s "-l" then
  121. ‌      let s =
  122.         if Config.ccomp_type = "msvc" then
  123.           String.sub s 2 (String.length s - 2) ^ ".lib"
  124.         else
  125.           s
  126.       in
  127.       c_libs := s :: !c_libs
  128.     else if starts_with s "-L" then
  129.      (c_Lopts := s :: !c_Lopts;
  130. ‌      let l = chop_prefix s "-L" in
  131.       if not (Filename.is_relative l) then rpath := l :: !rpath)
  132.     else if s = "-ocamlcflags" then
  133.       ocamlc_opts := next_arg s :: !ocamlc_opts
  134.     else if s = "-ocamlc" then
  135.       ocamlc := next_arg s
  136.     else if s = "-ocamlopt" then
  137.       ocamlopt := next_arg s
  138.     else if s = "-ocamloptflags" then
  139.       ocamlopt_opts := next_arg s :: !ocamlopt_opts
  140.     else if s = "-o" then
  141.       output := next_arg s
  142.     else if s = "-oc" then
  143.       output_c := next_arg s
  144.     else if s = "-dllpath" || s = "-R" || s = "-rpath" then
  145.       rpath := next_arg s :: !rpath
  146.     else if starts_with s "-R" then
  147.       rpath := chop_prefix s "-R" :: !rpath
  148.     else if s = "-Wl,-rpath" then
  149. ‌     (let a = next_arg s in
  150.       if starts_with a "-Wl,"
  151.       then rpath := chop_prefix a "-Wl," :: !rpath
  152.       else raise (Bad_argument("Option -Wl,-rpath expects a -Wl, argument")))
  153.     else if starts_with s "-Wl,-rpath," then
  154.       rpath := chop_prefix s "-Wl,-rpath," :: !rpath
  155.     else if starts_with s "-Wl,-R" then
  156.       rpath := chop_prefix s "-Wl,-R" :: !rpath
  157.     else if s = "-v" || s = "-verbose" then
  158.       verbose := true
  159.     else if s = "-version" then
  160.       print_version ()
  161.     else if s = "-vnum" then
  162.       print_version_num ()
  163.     else if starts_with s "-F" then
  164.       c_opts := s :: !c_opts
  165.     else if s = "-framework" then
  166. ‌      (let a = next_arg s in c_opts := a :: s :: !c_opts)
  167.     else if starts_with s "-" then
  168.       prerr_endline ("Unknown option " ^ s)
  169.     else
  170.       raise (Bad_argument("Don't know what to do with " ^ s))
  171.   done;
  172.   List.iter
  173.     (fun r -> r := List.rev !r)
  174.     [ bytecode_objs; native_objs; caml_libs; caml_opts;
  175.       c_libs; c_objs; c_opts; ld_opts; rpath ];
  176. (* Put -L options in front of -l options in -cclib to mimic -ccopt behavior *)
  177.   c_libs := !c_Lopts @ !c_libs;

  179.   if !output_c = "" then output_c := !output

  181. ‌let usage = "\
  182. Usage: ocamlmklib [options] <.cmo|.cma|.cmx|.ml|.mli|.o|.a|.obj|.lib|\
  183.                              .dll|.dylib files>\
  184. \nOptions are:\
  185. \n  -args <file>   Read additional newline-terminated command line arguments\
  186. \n                 from <file>\
  187. \n  -args0 <file>  Read additional null character terminated command line\
  188. \n                 arguments from <file>\
  189. \n  -cclib <lib>   C library passed to ocamlc -a or ocamlopt -a only\
  190. \n  -ccopt <opt>   C option passed to ocamlc -a or ocamlopt -a only\
  191. \n  -custom        Disable dynamic loading\
  192. \n  -g             Build with debug information\
  193. \n  -dllpath <dir> Add <dir> to the run-time search path for DLLs\
  194. \n  -F<dir>        Specify a framework directory (MacOSX)\
  195. \n  -framework <name>    Use framework <name> (MacOSX)\
  196. ‌\n  -help          Print this help message and exit\
  197. \n  --help         Same as -help\
  198. \n  -h             Same as -help\
  199. \n  -I <dir>       Add <dir> to the path searched for OCaml object files\
  200. \n  -failsafe      fall back to static linking if DLL construction failed\
  201. \n  -ldopt <opt>   C option passed to the shared linker only\
  202. \n  -linkall       Build OCaml archive with link-all behavior\
  203. \n  -l<lib>        Specify a dependent C library\
  204. \n  -L<dir>        Add <dir> to the path searched for C libraries\
  205. \n  -ocamlc <cmd>  Use <cmd> in place of \"ocamlc\"\
  206. \n  -ocamlcflags <opt>    Pass <opt> to ocamlc\
  207. \n  -ocamlopt <cmd> Use <cmd> in place of \"ocamlopt\"\
  208. \n  -ocamloptflags <opt>  Pass <opt> to ocamlopt\
  209. \n  -o <name>      Generated OCaml library is named <name>.cma or <name>.cmxa\
  210. \n  -oc <name>     Generated C library is named dll<name>.so or lib<name>.a\
  211. \n  -rpath <dir>   Same as -dllpath <dir>\
  212. \n  -R<dir>        Same as -rpath\
  213. \n  -verbose       Print commands before executing them\
  214. \n  -v             same as -verbose\
  215. \n  -version       Print version and exit\
  216. \n  -vnum          Print version number and exit\
  217. \n  -Wl,-rpath,<dir>     Same as -dllpath <dir>\
  218. \n  -Wl,-rpath -Wl,<dir> Same as -dllpath <dir>\
  219. \n  -Wl,-R<dir>          Same as -dllpath <dir>\
  220. \n"

  222. let command cmd =
  223.   if !verbose then (print_string "+ "; print_string cmd; print_newline());
  224.   Sys.command cmd

  226. ‌let scommand cmd =
  227.   if command cmd <> 0 then exit 2

  229. ‌let safe_remove s =
  230.   try Sys.remove s with Sys_error _ -> ()

  232. ‌let make_set l =
  233.   let rec merge l = function
  234.     []     -> List.rev l
  235.   | p :: r -> if List.mem p l then merge l r else merge (p::l) r
  236.   in
  237.   merge [] l

  239. ‌let make_rpath flag =
  240.   if !rpath = [] || flag = ""
  241.   then ""
  242.   else flag ^ String.concat ":" (make_set !rpath)

  244. ‌let make_rpath_ccopt flag =
  245.   if !rpath = [] || flag = ""
  246.   then ""
  247.   else "-ccopt " ^ flag ^ String.concat ":" (make_set !rpath)

  249. ‌let prefix_list pref l =
  250.   List.map (fun s -> pref ^ s) l

  252. let prepostfix pre name post =
  253.   let base = Filename.basename name in
  254. ‌  let dir = Filename.dirname name in
  255.   Filename.concat dir (pre ^ base ^ post)

  257. ‌let transl_path s =
  258.   match Sys.os_type with
  259.     | "Win32" ->
  260.         let s = Bytes.of_string s in
  261.         let rec aux i =
  262.           if i = Bytes.length s || Bytes.get s i = ' ' then s
  263.           else begin
  264.             if Bytes.get s i = '/' then Bytes.set s i '\\';
  265.             aux (i + 1)
  266.           end
  267.         in Bytes.to_string (aux 0)
  268.     | _ -> s

  270. ‌let flexdll_dirs =
  271.   let dirs =
  272.     let expand = Misc.expand_directory Config.standard_library in
  273.     List.map expand Config.flexdll_dirs
  274.   in
  275.   let f dir =
  276.     let dir =
  277.       if String.contains dir ' ' then
  278.         "\"" ^ dir ^ "\""
  279.       else
  280.         dir
  281.     in
  282.       "-L" ^ dir
  283.   in
  284.   List.map f dirs

  286. ‌let build_libs () =
  287.   if !c_objs <> [] then begin
  288.     if !dynlink then begin
  289.       let retcode = command
  290.           (Printf.sprintf "%s %s -o %s %s %s %s %s %s %s"
  291.              Config.mkdll
  292.              (if !debug then "-g" else "")
  293.              (prepostfix "dll" !output_c Config.ext_dll)
  294.              (String.concat " " !c_objs)
  295.              (String.concat " " !c_opts)
  296.              (String.concat " " !ld_opts)
  297.              (make_rpath Config.mksharedlibrpath)
  298.              (String.concat " " !c_libs)
  299.              (String.concat " " flexdll_dirs)
  300.           )
  301.       in
  302.       if retcode <> 0 then if !failsafe then dynlink := false else exit 2
  303.     end;
  304.     safe_remove (prepostfix "lib" !output_c Config.ext_lib);
  305.     scommand
  306.       (mklib (prepostfix "lib" !output_c Config.ext_lib)
  307.              (String.concat " " !c_objs) "");
  308.   end;
  309.   if !bytecode_objs <> [] then
  310.     scommand
  311.       (sprintf "%s -a %s %s %s -o %s.cma %s %s -dllib -l%s -cclib -l%s \
  312.                    %s %s %s %s"
  313.                   (transl_path !ocamlc)
  314.                   (if !debug then "-g" else "")
  315.                   (if !dynlink then "" else "-custom")
  316.                   (String.concat " " !ocamlc_opts)
  317.                   !output
  318.                   (String.concat " " !caml_opts)
  319.                   (String.concat " " !bytecode_objs)
  320.                   (Filename.basename !output_c)
  321.                   (Filename.basename !output_c)
  322.                   (String.concat " " (prefix_list "-ccopt " !c_opts))
  323.                   (make_rpath_ccopt Config.default_rpath)
  324.                   (String.concat " " (prefix_list "-cclib " !c_libs))
  325.                   (String.concat " " !caml_libs));
  326.   if !native_objs <> [] then
  327.     scommand
  328.       (sprintf "%s -a %s %s -o %s.cmxa %s %s -cclib -l%s %s %s %s %s"
  329.                   (transl_path !ocamlopt)
  330.                   (if !debug then "-g" else "")
  331.                   (String.concat " " !ocamlopt_opts)
  332.                   !output
  333.                   (String.concat " " !caml_opts)
  334.                   (String.concat " " !native_objs)
  335.                   (Filename.basename !output_c)
  336.                   (String.concat " " (prefix_list "-ccopt " !c_opts))
  337.                   (make_rpath_ccopt Config.default_rpath)
  338.                   (String.concat " " (prefix_list "-cclib " !c_libs))
  339.                   (String.concat " " !caml_libs))

  341. ‌let main () =
  342.   try
  343.     parse_arguments Sys.argv;
  344.     build_libs()
  345.   with
  346.   | Bad_argument "" ->
  347.       prerr_string usage; exit 0
  348.   | Bad_argument s ->
  349.       prerr_endline s; prerr_string usage; exit 4
  350.   | Sys_error s ->
  351.       prerr_string "System error: "; prerr_endline s; exit 4
  352.   | x ->
  353.       raise x

  355. let _ = main ()
